name: RAY
bio: [('Beginning', 'She first tried shooting at age eight. (raybassil.com, 01 May 2018)'), ('Reason', 'Her father competed in shooting. She would go with him on hunting trips and he noticed that she had talent. "I chose shooting because it is beautiful and unique. I have loved it since childhood. My passion has increased to such an extent that I begin to feel as if something is missing when I am not training." (sportscrunch.in, 13 May 2016; Facebook page, 01 May 2018; abdogedeon.com, 20 Apr 2010)'), ('Debut', '2006 for Lebanon (Athlete, 18 Sep 2014)'), ('Coach', "George Grace [fitness, personal] (Lebanese Shooting Federation's Facebook page, 18 Apr 2018; Vitality Fitness' Facebook page, 23 Apr 2018)"), ('Ambition', 'To win an Olympic gold medal. name: NACIF
bio: [('Ambition', 'To win a gold medal at the 2018 Asian Games in Indonesia, and to compete at the 2020 Olympic Games in Tokyo. (globoesporte.globo.com, 12 Mar 2018)'), ('Awards', "He was voted Lebanon's Best Athlete in all sports in 2014 and 2015. (globoesporte.globo.com, 03 Jul 2016)He was flag bearer for Lebanon at the opening ceremony of the 2014 Asian Games in Incheon, Republic of Korea. (Incheon INFO, 19 Sep 2014)"), ('Additional Information', 'Preferred techniquesIppon-seoi-nage (IJF, 17 Jul 2016)GeneralBRAZIL TO LEBANONHe was born in Brazil but his great-grandfather was Lebanese. He changed nationality to represent Lebanon in 2013. "Lebanon offered me the chance to travel to competitions, earn a salary, and stay in Brazil. The Brazilian Judo Confederation cannot send everyone to competitions, but in Lebanon, I\'m the guy." (loboesporte.globo.com, 03 Jul 2016; judoinside.com, 16 Apr 2016; judobase.org, 26 Aug 2013)RIO DISQUALIFICATION He was disqualified from the preliminary round of the men\'s judo 81kg category at the 2016 Olympic Games in Rio de Janeiro after he was adjudged to have performed an illegal joint-lock move. He initially refused to leave the mat before later apologising for his behaviour and the example he may have set to younger members of the crowd. "I apologised to the public because of my reaction. This reaction was an angry reaction, because I have trained very hard for the last four years. I have no idea why I was disqualified but I accept what the judge has said. Furthermore, I apologise to all the children who attended as I\'m very concerned about setting a good example to those who are the future of judo." (ONS, 09 Aug 2016)OCCUPATIONHe runs Espaco Team Nacif Elias, a judo club in Vitoria, Brazil. (Espaco Nacif Elias Facebook page, 24 May 2018; X-Combat Tv News, 15 May 2018) '), ('Hero', 'Brazilian judoka Luciano Correa. (Athlete, 18 Sep 2014)'), ('Influence', 'His father. (Athlete, 18 Sep 2014)'), ('Nickname', 'Crazy Dog (abdogedeon.com, 26 Mar 2018)'), ('Languages', 'English, Portuguese'), ('Highlights', 'JUDORankEventYearLocationAsian Games2-81 kg2014Incheon, KOROlympic Games17-81 kg2016Rio de Janeiro, BRAWorld Championships7-81 kg2014Chelyabinsk, RUS9-90 kg2017Budapest, HUN9-81 kg2009Rotterdam, NED17-81 kg2013Rio de Janeiro, BRAGrand Slam17-90 kg2017Paris, FRA17-81 kg2016Baku, AZE17-81 kg2015Baku, AZE33-90 kg2018Dusseldorf, GER33-81 kg2016Paris, FRAGrand Prix9-90 kg2017Dusseldorf, GER9-81 kg2016Samsun, TUR9-81 kg2016Tbilisi, GEO9-81 kg2015Zagreb, CRO9-90 kg2015Dusseldorf, GER17-81 kg2016Dusseldorf, GERWorld Cup1-90 kg2018Buenos Aires, ARG1-90 kg2018Santiago, CHI1-90 kg2017Buenos Aires, ARG1-81 kg2016Buenos Aires, ARG1-81 kg2016Lima, PER1-90 kg2015Montevideo, URU3-90 kg2017Santiago, CHIAsian Championships2-81 kg2016Tashkent, UZB7-81 kg2015Kuwait City, KUW9-90 kg2017Hong Kong, CHNIJF World Ranking57-90 kg2018')]

name: MAHASSEN HALA
bio: [('Beginning', 'She took up weightlifting in 2004 in Florida, United States of America. (teamusa.org, 18 Apr 2010)'), ('Reason', 'She began the sport at the request of her teacher, Thomas Bennett, who was a high school weightlifting coach. "One day my coach taught me how to snatch, and I have loved the sport ever since." (mahassenhala.com, 27 Jun 2018)'), ('Coach', 'Ryan Paiva [husband], USA; Ray Jones (mahassenhala.com, 27 Jun 2018)'), ('Training', 'She trains in Beaufort, South Carolina, United States of America, and in Beirut, Lebanon as a full-time athlete. (mahassenhala.com, 27 Jun 2018)'), ('Ambition', 'To become the first female weightlifter to represent Lebanon at the Olympic Games at the 2020 Games in Tokyo. (mahassenhala.com, 27 Jun 2018)'), ('Additional Information', 'GeneralREPRESENTING LEBANONShe was granted release by USA Weightlifting to represent Lebanon. (barbend.com, 04 May 2016)NATIONAL FIRSTShe became the first female Lebanese weightlifter to compete at the world championships when she took part in the 2014 World Championships in Almaty, Kazakhstan. (mahassenhala.com, 16 Jan 2016; mahassenhala.com, 27 Jun 2018) '), ('Relatives', 'Her husband and coach Ryan Paiva competed as a junior for the United States of America in weightlifting from 2005 to 2007. name: Alissa
bio: [('Beginning', 'She began training in 2006 while on vacation in Chekhov, Russian Federation. (instagram.com, 04 Feb 2018)'), ('Reason', 'She had already been training in artistic gymnastics in Lebanon, but decided she preferred rhythmic gymnastics and switched sports. (instagram.com, 04 Feb 2018)'), ('Coach', 'Elena Tkachenko [personal] (instagram.com, 04 Feb 2018)'), ('Training', 'She trains 21 hours a week. (instagram.com, 04 Feb 2018)'), ('Additional Information', 'GeneralBOND WITH COACHShe appreciates the mutually respectful relationship she has with her coach, Elena Tkachenko. "[Tkachenko] is not very strict in general but if the case is serious then she can be very strict, which is helpful. All in all Elena and I are very close, we have a sort of friendship relationship in which we find a balance between training and outside stuff. She always shares stories from her career as an example to many situations. She also likes to show us the difference between modern gymnastics and the old-school gymnastics, or highlights some similarities." (instagram.com, 02 Jan 2018)FAMILY BACKGROUNDHer father is Lebanese and her mother is Russian. (instagram.com, 04 Feb 2018) '), ('Hero', 'Russian rhythmic gymnast Margarita Mamun.
